physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mild ankle edema; Two surgical scars on the back; Low back tender on palpation; Normal heart, lung, and abdominal examination; Neurologic examination showed normal mental status and cranial-nerve function. Motor examination: normal tone, bulk, strength. Marked diminution of vibration perception at toes and ankles; impaired sense of joint position at toes; reduced cold sensation at feet; decreased pinprick sensation below knees and in fingers; intact dorsum of hand and forearm; area of allodynia on left lateral calf and foot; tendon reflexes ++ at biceps and triceps, + at knees and ankles; absent plantar reflexes; unsteady on Rombergâ€™s test.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Numbness has slowly begun to involve hands and forearms, strength preserved; previously had severe pain and neuropathy limited to feet and legs.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Electromyographic examination revealed minimal abnormalities in intrinsic foot muscles; normal motor and sensory conduction studies, and somatosensory evoked potentials.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Glucose tolerance testing: Fasting blood glucose: 97 mg/dL, 2-hour post-challenge glucose: 216 mg/dL.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Nerve conduction studies: normal; Skin biopsies showed scattered perivascular mononuclear infiltrates; axonal swellings consistent with early degeneration.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: 11 months later, skin biopsy revealed a 61% reduction in axonal density, indicating progression.
